2701.title: Small Road
2701.description:
A small road paved with cobblestones leads toward Glyndane to the
west. You see the tall towers on either side of the city gates.
Between the stones in the road are grains of sand, blown in from
the Sands of Sorrow to the south.

2702.title: Small Road
2702.description:
A small road has been paved with cobblestones, leading toward
Glyndane to the west. The Sands of Sorrow are nearby. You see
some sand building up between the stones in the road, having
blown in from the south.

2703.title: Small Road
2703.description:
A small road has been paved with cobblestones, leading toward
Glyndane to the west. The Sands of Sorrow are nearby. You see
some sand building up between the stones in the road, having
blown in from the south. To the south, a small path leads toward
the wasteland.

2704.title: Path in the Desert
2704.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands
of Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the
road. You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out
whose they are. You hear an occasional splash.

2705.title: Path in the Desert
2705.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands
of Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the
road. You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out
whose they are. You hear an occasional splash.

2706.title: Path in the Desert
2706.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands
of Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the
road. You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out
whose they are. You hear an occasional splash. To the south is a
wooden bridge.

2707.title: Bridge
2707.description:
A small wooden bridge spans the river. It appears to have been
newly constructed, and well-constructed at that, sturdy despite
its size.

2708.title: Path in the Desert
2708.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands
of Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the
road. You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out
whose they are. You hear an occasional splash. To the north is a
wooden bridge.

2709.title: Path in the Desert
2709.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands
of Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the
road. You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out
whose they are. You hear an occasional splash.

2710.title: Path in the Desert
2710.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands
of Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the
road. You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out
whose they are. You hear an occasional splash. Looking across some
of the barren land you see a line of shrubs or maybe trees, but the
land between this path and that not quite natural wall is very sandy
and difficult to traverse. Sticking with the path makes more sense
here.

2711.title: Path in the Desert
2711.description:
A path lined with rocks leads through the outskirts of the Sands of
Sorrow. Sand has blown in from the south to finely cover the road.
You see a myriad of footprints here but cannot make out whose they
are. Looking across some of the barren land you see a line of shrubs
or maybe trees, but the land between this path and that not quite
natural wall is very sandy and difficult to traverse. Sticking with
the path makes more sense here.

2712.title: Path in the Desert
2712.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path, darker soil mixed with sand from
the desert to the south and lined by a neat row of stones. The path
turns here, stretching to the north and to the east. Looking east,
you see a gate. Southeast you see a line of thick shrubs.

2713.title: By the White-Washed Gate
2713.description:
Two white-washed poles rise from the ground on either side of the
path, and between them is a wooden gate, also white-washed. Across
the top is a sign suspended from the two poles by a couple of chains,
swinging gently in the breeze. Beyond the gate the path continues,
and you can see past the thick row of shrubs to see a field of crops
to the north of the path, and a pasture and a barn to the south. The
path leads westward away from the gate.

extras.description:
The sign suspended between the two white-washed poles tells you:
WELCOME TO THE MANOR
- WARRIORS WELCOME -
MAGES GO HOME!

2714.title: By the White-Washed Gate
2714.description:
To the west is a white-washed gate between two tall white poles. A
sign suspended between the poles above you swings gently in the
breeze. Nothing is written on the sign that you can see. To the
north is a crop field, to the south pasture. The path of dark soil
well trod upon extends eastward through this manor, and through and
past the gate to the west.

2715.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2715.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
beyond this amazing oasis. To the north is a field of crops, to the
south a pasture.

2716.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2716.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
beyond this amazing oasis. To the north is a field of crops, to the
south a pasture.

2717.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2717.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
beyond this amazing oasis. To the north is a field of crops, to the
south a pasture.

2718.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2718.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
beyond this amazing oasis. To the north is a field of crops, to the
south a pasture.

2719.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2719.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
beyond this amazing oasis. To the north is a field of crops and beyond,
a silo. To the south you see a pasture.

2720.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2720.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
beyond this amazing oasis. To the north is a thick, impassable row
of trees and shrubs, to the south a row of very small houses.

2721.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2721.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
to the south of this lush oasis. To the east is an intersection of
paths.

2722.title: Intersection
2722.description:
In all four directions the path extends, intersecting here. To the
east you see a great house, to the west the small houses, the
pasture, barns, and fields. Looking northward, you see a small building
on either side of the path. Gazing to the south, you see a chapel.

2723.title: On a Well-Trodden Path
2723.description:
You walk upon a well-trodden path within the manor. Small stones
line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand from the desert
to the south. Looking eastward you see a great house, and to the
west is an intersection of paths.

2724.title: Before the Great House
2724.description:
You stand upon a well-trodden path just outside the great house.
Small stones line the path, and the dark soil is mixed with sand
from the desert to the south. Looking to the east you see the
entrance to the house. The path extends westward.

2725.title: On a Path
2725.description:
This path appears to lead to a water well in the north, and two
buildings on either side of the path farther along than you are
now.

2726.title: On a Path
2726.description:
This path appears to lead to a water well farther north. To the
west is the blacksmith's and northeast is a small building. You
hear the sound of metal striking metal from the west, and feel
some heat. The door is open and hooked to stay open.

2727.title: At the Well
2727.description:
The well was constructed here to take advantage of the river
without falling prey to the steep banks to the north. You can
see the river from here, it flows silently and slow. To the
east is a small building. A new road is being built to the
north, leading to the river.

2728.title: On a Path
2728.description:
This path appears to lead to a chapel to the south. The path
itself is well-trodden, with sand mixing with the dark soil.
Looking beyond the chapel you can see the wasteland of the
Sands of Sorrow.

2729.title: On a Path
2729.description:
This path appears to lead to a chapel to the south. The path
itself is well-trodden, with sand mixing with the dark soil.
Looking beyond the chapel you can see the wasteland of the
Sands of Sorrow.

2730.title: Before the Chapel
2730.description:
You stand on a well-trodden path leading up to a small
chapel. The door to the chapel is to the east. Looking
south you can see the wasteland of the Sands of Sorrow.

2731.title: Blacksmith
2731.description:
Heat rises from the blazing forge in the western part of the
blacksmith's shop. It is hard to breathe in here, and the
temperature begins to affect you.

2732.title: School
2732.description:
A very small building was constructed here for use by the manor
folk to increase their knowledge. The Lord of the Manor apparently
believes in educating his serfs. A shelf along one wall holds a
few small books, while on the few tables in the room are slates.

2733.title: Chapel
2733.description:
Well-constructed pews of oak wood are here for the few faithful of
the Manor to sit while attending worship.

2734.title: Chapel
2734.description:
A small but nice oaken altar is here. The symbols carved lovingly
into its sides appear to be swords. On a happy banner hanging
behind the altar are the words: Valor, Honor, Glory.

2735.title: Private Room
2735.description:
This room behind the altar room seems to be the dwelling place of
a Monk. It is sparsely furnished with a simple bed formed of rushes
on the floor, and a low table holds a small goblet.

2736.title: Small Graveyard
2736.description:
Here there are a few gravestones marking the final resting places
of various people who worked to build and maintain the Manor. One
gravestone stands out beyond the others. The graveyard extends to
the east, and to the north is a door into the chapel.

extras.description:
You read the inscription:
Here Lies
The Body
of
My Favorite
Shepherd
REX
who never let
the sheep escape

2737.title: Small Graveyard
2737.description:
Here there are a few gravestones marking the final resting places
of various people who worked to build and maintain the Manor. One
gravestone sits upon a small grassy mound. The graveyard extends
to the west.

extras.description:
You look at the inscription:
R.I.P.
Beloved Daughter
Marianna
Aged 6 Months

2738.title: Entrance to the Great House
2738.description:
The great house is richly furnished with the finery the Lord
collected during his youth as a Crusader. While he no longer
serves the Crusade actively, he has not given up his beliefs
in the purity of a soul untainted by magic, and a body well-
honed by hard work and physical exertion. On the wall near the
door is a tapestry with words woven in gold thread on a dark
blue background, framed with green vines and leaves. To the north
is the library, to the south a sitting room.

extras.description:
Difficulty is a severe instructor,
set over us by the supreme ordinance
of a parental guardian and legislator,
who knows us better than we know ourselves,
and He loves us better, too.
He that wrestles with us strengthens our
nerves, and sharpens our skill. Our
antagonist is our helper. This amicable
conflict with difficulty obliges us to
an intimate acquaintance with our object,
and compels us to consider it in all its
relations.
It will not suffer us to be superficial.
--Burke the Wise--

2739.title: Hall
2739.description:
The great house is richly furnished with the finery the Lord
collected during his youth as a Crusader. To the north is a
study, to the south a dining room, and to the east a bedroom.
Westward is the entrance to the great house. Near one of the
arched entranceways is a small plaque.

extras.description:
He who envies another
admits his own inferiority.

2740.title: Library
2740.description:
Among the books on the table in this finely decorated room are
'Animal Husbandry', 'Crop Rotation Theory', 'Natural and Forced
Irrigation', and 'Life Without Magic'. The library extends to
the east. A wooden plaque hangs on the northern wall. On the
western wall near the window is a faded parchment in a weathered
frame. The ink near the top is faded and old, the ink near the
bottom fresh and dark looking.

extras.description:
It is better to have
a lion at the head
of an army of sheep,
than a sheep at the head
of an army of lions.
--DeFoe--

The names on the parchment seem to be those of the leaders of the
Crusaders of Valor. At the very top, in very faded ink, is the
name: RENGAR. Something stained the parchment just below, because
it is impossible to make out the most of the other names until you
reach a faint entry which seems to read: HAASTUS, then more illegible
entries until you find a faded but darker ink entry: RACQUEL. Then you
see a small set of letters which indicate that a maelstrom blew
through and wiped out the old order. The list of names following are
in a darker ink, each one below darker than the previous above:
RIPSAW
NYCHOLAS
GALAD
MELDRAD
GRYLETH SHORTLEG (1st term)
XAITHIUS
GRYLETH SHORTLEG (2nd term)
KALLIBRAK TERRASQUE
STORLIAN
XAILYTH
RESTIN DELRIST
JORD ROSHNAK
NIXALIS n'GORLAS
JOJA KRULL OF DHAES DRAE AESILON
PHLARE BA'CILICA
JEDKE KORONOS
TYBERIUS DUPREE
KRAZAR LECHIUM
SCATHA
KOROSK EVENTAL'SK
MONKIFER, M.D.
GELADOR STONEFIST
DEBASHE O'TARI
VROTHGAR HIEMMDALE
GRALTHGERAN THUNLAUGR
ROKHOMAAS IRONHOOF
MOTSOGNIR OAK-SKIN
ITOLIMAL TA'DAWEN
XARTAUL HERIGAUUL
AELSON ROUSH
DURITZ CLAYPOOL
RIGAHI REDIRON
UTHBERT GOAT
ORNLU
BEDROS SILVERHORN
KORRICK
SLATE MAGUIRE
SKEAN SKOLARSKI
JHELT
WOJCIECHA
ELDRAN
SEGOVAX RAW
EMMA NARWEEN
WOLDRUN
THRAKYR
BLEYARD T'RANNIMAL
DANDURAN VERKE
BLEYARD T'RANNIMAL
DEVO DOHGIN MAKATO
NARUNDEL THAELKELAS
SIMURGH KHVARENAH
RANGVALDR "SHARK BAIT" INGHARD
BARKER SCAR

2741.title: Study
2741.description:
The library to the west is part of this room, but here there is
only a song book, and near a small wooden stool is a large lute.
A cross-stitched bit of cloth framed in oak hangs from the
eastern wall. A large oaken door is to the east, right by that
cross-stitched plaque.

extras.description:
..................
.  True Courage  .
.     scorns     .
.  to vent her   .
.  prowess in a  .
.    storm of    .
.     words,     .
.  And to the    .
.    valiant     .
. action  speaks .
.     alone.     .
.                .
.     --Smollett .
..................

2742.title: Sitting Room
2742.description:
Perhaps this room would be better described as a spinning and
weaving room. In the southwest corner is a spinning wheel, next
to which are spools of thread and piles of flax. By the southern
wall is a medium-sized loom. The Lady of the Manor is apparently
an excellent spinner and weaver. Draped over one chair is a
flaxen tunic, its material soft to the touch.

2743.title: Dining Room
2743.description:
A huge table surrounded by chairs dominates this room. To the east
is the kitchen. You know this because there are delicious odors
coming from that direction.

2744.title: Bedroom
2744.description:
This is obviously the Lord and Lady's bedroom. A huge bed dominates
the room, a small table on either side of the headboard. Upon each
small table is a partly burned candle in a graceful candle holder.

2745.title: Bedroom
2745.description:
This bedroom is a child's bedroom. A small bed sits against the
eastern wall. Near it is a small table, upon which is a nearly
spent candle in a small dish, the wax about to drip over the
edges. There are toys on the floor. The door is hooked to the
wall, remaining open. Perhaps the child once locked himself in
and the Lord and Lady wish to prevent another such occurrance?

2746.title: Kitchen
2746.description:
Tables for chopping vegetables line one wall, tables for cutting
meat line another. In the center is an open fire, above which
is a metallic cone supported by three cast iron posts. A pipe
leads from the cone to the ceiling, and out through the roof. Two
sturdy posts support a bar from which hangs a cauldron.

2747.title: House
2747.description:
It is a modest little dwelling, with rushes on the ground for
beds. In one corner you see a pile of rags.

2748.title: House
2748.description:
It is a modest little dwelling, with rushes on the ground for
beds. In one corner you see a pile of rags.

2749.title: House
2749.description:
It is a modest little dwelling, with rushes on the ground for
beds. In one corner you see a pile of rags.

2750.title: House
2750.description:
It is a modest little dwelling, with rushes on the ground for
beds. In one corner you see a pile of rags.

2751.title: House
2751.description:
It is a modest little dwelling, with rushes on the ground for
beds. In one corner you see a pile of rags.

2752.title: House
2752.description:
It is a modest little dwelling, with rushes on the ground for
beds. In one corner you see a pile of rags.

2753.title: Silo
2753.description:
Here is where the excess food is stored. It appears that mice
have gotten into the stores here.

2754.title: Barn
2754.description:
The chickens are kept in this part of the barn. Many nests are
here on several levels. It seems crowded.

2755.title: Entrance to the Barn
2755.description:
The big barn extends to the west and south. The distinct odors
of chickens and cows assail your nose. On the walls here are
some harnesses hanging from nails, with hoes and rakes leaning
against the wall in haphazard fashion.

2756.title: Barn
2756.description:
Cow stalls are here, empty now, but in foul weather the cows
are herded in here for protection from the elements, albeit
a little protection, for you can see there are holes in the
barn's roof. A chill breeze slips through cracks in the walls.

2757.title: Barn
2757.description:
Cow stalls are here, empty now, but in foul weather the cows
are herded in here for protection from the elements, albeit
a little protection, for you can see there are holes in the
barn's roof. The walls are also not entirely solid, letting
in a chill breeze.

2758.title: Sheep Barn
2758.description:
Here is where the sheep are put when the weather turns foul. It
seems rather small for the flock usually grazing on the manor.
The roof looks as though it could use a little repair, and a chill
breeze blows through cracks in the walls.

2759.title: Pasture
2759.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the sheep barn,
to the east houses. Shrubs and trees line the south as a windblock.

2760.title: Pasture
2760.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the sheep barn,
to the east houses. Shrubs and trees line the south as a windblock.

2761.title: Pasture
2761.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, far to
the east, houses.

2762.title: Pasture
2762.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, far to
the east, houses.

2763.title: Pasture
2763.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, far to
the east, houses. To the south is a small house, its door hanging
open.

2764.title: Pasture
2764.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, to
the east, houses. To the south is a small house, its door hanging
open.

2765.title: Pasture
2765.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the far west is the barn.
To the south and the east is a small house, its door hanging open.

2766.title: Pasture
2766.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, far to
the east, houses.

2767.title: Pasture
2767.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, far to
the east, houses.

2768.title: Pasture
2768.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, to
the east and south, houses.

2769.title: Pasture
2769.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the west is the barn, to
the east and south, houses.

2770.title: Pasture
2770.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. Far to the west is the barn.
To the south are houses, and to the east, one small house with its
door hanging open.

2771.title: Pasture
2771.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. North is the entrance to the
Manor, and west is a row of shrubs and trees planted as a windblock.
The pasture extends east and southeast. South is a barn.

2772.title: Pasture
2772.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. North is the path through the
Manor, south is the barn, and the pasture extends to the east and
southeast.

2773.title: Pasture
2773.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the north is the path
through the Manor. The pasture extends south, east, and west.

2774.title: Pasture
2774.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the north is the path
through the Manor. The pasture extends south, east, and west.

2775.title: Pasture
2775.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the north is the path
through the Manor. The pasture extends south, east, and west.

2776.title: Pasture
2776.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the north is the path
through the Manor. The pasture extends south, east, and west.

2777.title: Pasture
2777.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into a lush pasture
for the use of his cattle and sheep. To the north is the path
through the Manor. The pasture extends south and west. To the east
is a small house, its door hanging open.

2778.title: Field
2778.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the south is
the path through the Manor. To the west is a thick line of
shrubs and trees, planted as a windblock.

2779.title: Field
2779.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the south is
the path through the Manor.

2780.title: Field
2780.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the south is
the path through the Manor.

2781.title: Field
2781.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the south is
the path through the Manor.

2782.title: Field
2782.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the south is
the path through the Manor.

2783.title: Field
2783.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the south is
the path through the Manor. To the east is a row of shrubs and
trees planted to serve as a windblock.

2784.title: Field
2784.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. A thick row of
shrubs and trees grows to the west, serving as a windblock.

2785.title: Field
2785.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north.

2786.title: Field
2786.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north.

2787.title: Field
2787.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north.

2788.title: Field
2788.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north.

2789.title: Field
2789.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the east is a
wall of shrubs and trees, a windblock to protect the fields.
North is a tall cylindrical structure, not unlike a tower.

2790.title: Field
2790.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. This is the north-
west corner of the field. To the north and west are a wall of
shrubs and trees planted as a windblock for protection of the
fields from the harsh winds of the desert. From the north is
the sound of an occasional splash.

2791.title: Field
2791.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the north is a
wall of shrubs and trees planted as a windblock for protection
of the fields from the harsh winds of the desert. From beyond
that living wall you hear the sound of an occasional splash.

2792.title: Field
2792.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the north is a
wall of shrubs and trees planted as a windblock for protection
of the fields from the harsh winds of the desert. From beyond
that living wall you hear the sound of an occasional splash.

2793.title: Field
2793.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the north is a
wall of shrubs and trees planted as a windblock for protection
of the fields from the harsh winds of the desert. From beyond
that living wall you hear the sound of an occasional splash.

2794.title: Field
2794.description:
Through the enlightened methods of irrigation, the Lord of the
Manor was able to turn this edge of the desert into usable
cropland. Rows and rows of grain and vegetable crops grow well
here, irrigated from the river to the north. To the north is a
wall of shrubs and trees planted as a windblock for protection
of the fields from the harsh winds of the desert. From beyond
that living wall you hear the sound of an occasional splash. To
the east is a tall cylindrical structure not unlike a tower.

2795.title: On a Path
2795.description:
This path appears to lead to a water well to the south, and a
river to the north. There are strong laborers working here. They
are smoothing out a road to the north. Some have begun constructing
a rock bridge to cross the river.

2796.title: Bridge Over the River
2796.description:
A sturdy bridge made of rock and mortar extends over the river.
As you cross it, you see masons putting finishing touches on the
bridge. Although it is a fairly new bridge, there are clumps of
dirt and stray stones to show where feet have trodden. The bridge
extends north and south. To the south is a path leading to a water
well, and to the north, a path leading to an archway which appears
to lead into an area being worked by gardeners.

2797.title: On a path
2797.description:
This path leads toward a stone bridge over a river to the south. To
the north is an archway which appears to be an entry into an area
currently being worked on by gardeners and construction workers.
The gardeners are planting trees, and the construction workers are
fashioning either a bridge over a pond, or tables with benches.
Far to the north beyond the pond, a small cabin is being built. The
area is surrounded by walls formed of thick logs.
